meanings.definition: A formal written request, typically signed by many people, appealing to authority in respect of a particular cause.
meanings.sent1: The petition to save the playground was signed by all the kids in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: She submitted a petition to the city council asking for more bike lanes.
meanings.sent3: The petition to have ice cream for lunch every day was a hit with the students.
meanings.sent4: The petition for longer recess was a cry for freedom in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent5: The petition for extra homework was met with groans from the students.

meanings.definition: To make or present a formal request to (an authority) with respect to a particular cause.
meanings.sent1: They decided to petition the mayor for a new community center.
meanings.sent2: He plans to petition the court for custody of his children.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly petitioned her cat for more treats by writing a letter.
meanings.sent4: The workers petitioned for better working conditions by going on strike.
meanings.sent5: The students petitioned the principal for a longer lunch break.
